metadata.title: CVE-2020-24587 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The 802.11 standard that underpins Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA, WPA2, andWPA3) and Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) doesn't require that all fragmentsof a frame are encrypted under the same key. An adversary can abuse this todecrypt selected fragments when another device sends fragmented frames andthe WEP, CCMP, or GCMP encryption key is periodically renewed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-24587` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-151-generic - 4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-151-generic - 4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-151-lowlatency - 4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1109-aws - 4.15.0-1109.116~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1121-azure - 4.15.0-1121.134~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1106-gcp - 4.15.0-1106.120~16.04.1
